intro: Circaea taiwaniana, commonly known as Taiwan whitebeard, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Circaea taiwaniana is often found in rocky or forested areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
